paragraphs.text:
%md
# About
**Lab:** Hive Introduction
**Objective:** Become familiar with using Hive tables on Hadoop
**File locations:** hostname:/tmp/marvel HDFS://data/marvel/marvel-wikia-data.csv
**Successful outcome:** Understanding the differences between external and managed Hive tables
**Before you begin:**
**Related lessons:** Hive Programming

---

msg.data:
About

Lab: Hive Introduction
Objective: Become familiar with using Hive tables on Hadoop
File locations: hostname:/tmp/marvel HDFS://data/marvel/marvel-wikia-data.csv
Successful outcome: Understanding the differences between external and managed Hive tables
Before you begin:
Related lessons: Hive Programming

paragraphs.title: Get the data from github
List the directory /tmp/marvel
Move the local data into HDFS
paragraphs.text:
%sh
sudo -u hdfs hdfs dfs -rm -r -skipTrash /data/marvel
sudo -u hdfs hdfs dfs -mkdir -p /data/marvel
sudo -u hdfs hdfs dfs -put /tmp/marvel/marvel-wikia-data.csv /data/marvel

msg.data: rm: `/data/marvel': No such file or directory

paragraphs.title: Grant Hive access to /data/marvel
Use HDFS to list the contents of /data/marvel
1 - List the Hive tables

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.text:
%md
We are going to create a marvel_comics_stage **external** table to store our data.

~~~
CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE marvel_comics_stage ( 
                        page_id string,
                        name string,
                        urlslug string,
                        ID string,
                        ALIGN string,
                        EYE string,
                        HAIR string,
                        SEX string,
                        GSM string,
                        ALIVE string,
                        APPEARANCES int,
                        FIRST_APPEARANCES string,
                        YEAR string
                        ) 
ROW FORMAT DELIMITED 
FIELDS TERMINATED BY ',' 
LOCATION '/warehouse/tablespace/external/hive/marvel_comics_stage/'
~~~

But first we need to drop the table if it already exists.

paragraphs.text:
%md
Now we are going to create a marvel_comics **managed** table to store our data.

~~~
CREATE TABLE marvel_comics ( 
                        page_id string,
                        name string,
                        urlslug string,
                        ID string,
                        ALIGN string,
                        EYE string,
                        HAIR string,
                        SEX string,
                        GSM string,
                        ALIVE string,
                        APPEARANCES int,
                        FIRST_APPEARANCES string,
                        YEAR string
                        ) 
STORED AS ORC
~~~

But first we need to drop the table if it already exists.

msg.data:

                        page_id string,
                        name string,

                        HAIR string,
                        SEX string,
                        GSM string,
                        ALIVE string,
                        APPEARANCES int,
                        FIRST_APPEARANCES string,
                        YEAR string
                        ) 
STORED AS ORC

But first we need to drop the table if it already exists.

paragraphs.text:
%md
# Result
**You have now:** You have now successfully created and populated external and managed Hive tables.

---

msg.data:
Result

You have now: You have now successfully created and populated external and managed Hive tables.

paragraphs.title: 3 - Create an external table marvel_comics_stage
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive)
CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE marvel_comics_stage ( 
                        page_id string,
                        name string,
                        urlslug string,
                        ID string,
                        ALIGN string,
                        EYE string,
                        HAIR string,
                        SEX string,
                        GSM string,
                        ALIVE string,
                        APPEARANCES int,
                        FIRST_APPEARANCES string,
                        YEAR string
                        ) 
ROW FORMAT DELIMITED 
FIELDS TERMINATED BY ',' 
LOCATION '/warehouse/tablespace/external/hive/marvel_comics_stage/'

name	string	
urlslug	string	
id	string	
align	string	
eye	string	
hair	string	
sex	string

appearances	int	
first_appearances	string	
year	string

paragraphs.title: 6 - Load the marvel comic data into our marvel_comics_stage table
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive)
LOAD DATA INPATH '/data/marvel/marvel-wikia-data.csv' OVERWRITE INTO TABLE marvel_comics_stage;

paragraphs.title: 10 - Create managed table marvel_comic stored as ORC format
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive)
CREATE TABLE marvel_comics ( 
                        page_id string,
                        name string,
                        urlslug string,
                        ID string,
                        ALIGN string,
                        EYE string,
                        HAIR string,
                        SEX string,
                        GSM string,
                        ALIVE string,
                        APPEARANCES int,
                        FIRST_APPEARANCES string,
                        YEAR string) 
STORED AS ORC;

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: 11 - Use an ITAS statement to insert the data
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive)
INSERT INTO TABLE marvel_comics SELECT * from marvel_comics_stage;

paragraphs.text:
%md
We hope you've enjoyed this lab. Below are additional resources that you should find useful:

1. [Cloudera Apache Spark Tutorials](http://hortonworks.com/tutorials/#tuts-developers) are your natural next step where you can explore Spark in more depth.
2. [Cloudera Community Connection (HCC)](https://community.hortonworks.com/spaces/85/data-science.html?type=question) is a great resource for questions and answers on Spark, Data Analytics/Science, and many more Big Data topics.
3. [Cloudera Apache Spark Docs](https://docs.hortonworks.com/HDPDocuments/HDP3/HDP-3.0.1/spark-overview/content/analyzing_data_with_apache_spark.html) - official Spark documentation.
4. [Cloudera Apache Zeppelin Docs](https://docs.hortonworks.com/HDPDocuments/HDP3/HDP-3.0.1/zeppelin-overview/content/overview.html) - official Zeppelin documentation.

msg.data:
We hope you've enjoyed this lab. Below are additional resources that you should find useful:

  1. Cloudera Apache Spark Tutorials are your natural next step where you can explore Spark in more depth.
  2. Cloudera Community Connection (HCC) is a great resource for questions and answers on Spark, Data Analytics/Science, and many more Big Data topics.
  3. Cloudera Apache Spark Docs - official Spark documentation.
  4. Cloudera Apache Zeppelin Docs - official Zeppelin documentation.
